title: Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: save a life hits its 10,000 target .
dispersal order put in place over the weekend in lincoln .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: well that 's it from me for today .
we 'll be back on monday from 08:00 with live news , sport , weather and travel from across the county .
for now , i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a great weekend .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: town council and volunteers to clean up river slea after litter complaints
text: after complaints about the amount of rubbish being thrown into the river slea in sleafird potentially harming wildlife , the town council and volunteers are taking action .
the river clean team , manned by local volunteers , will be out this sunday and will meet at the national centre for craft and design at 10am .
author: Sleaford Standard

documents.title: this evening 's weather
text: it 's coming to the end of the day , so let 's take a look at friday night 's weather .
dry at first this evening with some late sunshine in the east .
thickening cloud and outbreaks of rain will spread from the southwest late evening into the early hours of saturday , some heavy .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: all aboard ! trading standards is catching the bus
text: trading standards will be jumping on the bus on monday to help raises awareness of scams .
it 's all part of scams awareness month , where officers will be offering advice to passengers on the interconnect 6 skegness to lincoln service between wragby and horncastle .
the initiative is made possible thanks to the lincolnshire police and stagecoach 's # busbeat partnership which sees pcsos using services as a way of promoting crime prevention .
getting on the bus will enable our officers us to spread the word to as many residents as possible about how to protect themselves from these criminals .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: three people given suspended prison sentences after boston nightclub brawl
text: three people involved in a large fight at a boston nightclub have been given suspended prison sentences .
it broke out at the town 's goldfinger club last october .
lincoln crown court heard single mothers demi healy and ayla carlon , both from elizabeth road in boston , were enjoying a rare night out when they became involved in the fight .
23-year-old healy was seen on cctv pushing and punching a man .
carlon , who 's 19-years-old , was shown repeatedly stamping on a man and then kicking another clubber in the back .
38-year-old terry raggo , from fenside road , was also involved .
he was seen throwing punches and swearing at the police .
after pleading guilty to affray , the judge said he was only sparing them custody because they had no history of violence .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: witness appeal after woman on bike hit by car
text: lincolnshire police are appealing for witnesses to help with their investigation into a collision in spalding .
a woman on a red bicycle suffered minor injuries after a collision with a car at around 20:20 on tuesday 4 july .
the incident occurred near the entrance to the castle sports complex on albion street .
anyone with any information is being asked to contact the police on 101 .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : save a life hits 10,000
text: it 's been a great day for anyone involved in bbc radio lincolnshire 's save a life campaign , as today it was announced that 10,000 people in the county have been trained in cpr .
in case you missed it , here 's the moment that figure was revealed
now we 're giving it until the end of the year to see just how many people lives and st john ambulance can train .
if you want to get involved and learn the life saving skill , drop us an email .
in case you missed it , here 's the moment we announced we 'd hit our target of 10,000 people trained in cpr in lincolnshire !
# savealife
i wish @ twitterid would do a scheme like this .
i would join .
life saving knowledge !
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lifeboat aids three boats caught in heavy winds
text: three boats which got into trouble when hit by heavy squalls had to be rescued by wells lifeboat yesterday .
the first call was to the sea mist cabin cruiser .
one of its two engines had overheated and had to be shut down , making it difficult to manouvre as skipper richard comrie tried to cross the bar into wells harbour .
they were between 10-15 miles off the north norfolk harbour when they radioed for help , and with sea washing over the boat they nearly lost their dinghy .
the second rescue was of an elderly couple .
their 65ft barge was caught in heavy seas off salthouses , and was making little progress because of the heavy westerly wind .
the third vessel , a 22ft yacht , suffered engine and communications failure , but managed to raise the alarm on a mobile before it stopped working .
she was reported to be 10 miles north of wells and 10 miles east of skegness .
it was a race against the ebbing tide to get her over the bar while there was still enough depth of water .
lifeboat spokesman john mitchell says it was `` touch and go '' .
the yacht was located by skegness lifeboat who towed her to the approaches of wells harbour where she was met by wells lifeboat they just managed to beat the falling tide . ''

documents.title: lord porter calls for a review of building regulations
text: the local government association is calling for a review of building regulations following the fire at grenfell tower .
it says the current system is confusing , and it 'd be wrong to wait for the results of the public inquiry , before taking action .
the lga 's chairman is lord gary porter - who 's also the leader of south holland district council .
he wants assurances that people are n't at risk :
my real interest at the moment is to try and make sure that the properties that are going up now are going up in a way that we can all have certainty that they 're safe .
the public enquiry will work out who needs to be blamed for what , we need to be able to ensure the public that it is safe to live in high rise buildings .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: our top stories so far today from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : a brighter afternoon
text: here 's a look at the weather for the rest of the day with me , owain wyn evans :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: fields of gold in lincolnshire
text: it 's been a bit of a mixed bag weather wise today , but we 've certainly had some great photos from our lincolnshire weather watchers !
harvest is in full swing , thanks to milliegeorge & me for this great shot of the hay bales in caythorpe .
and i 'm sure theresa may would love to run through these fields
thanks to southwithamerbaz for this one .
if you want to join our weather watchers just register online .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: jail sentences for grantham men totaling 40 years
text: members of a drugs gang which brought thousands of pounds worth of cocaine and heroin into grantham have been given jail sentences totaling 40 years .
the drugs were bought into lincolnshire from london .
lincoln crown court heard heard that the drugs - which came into grantham over an eight month period in 2015 - had a street value of more than £ 375,000 .
today , five lincolnshire men have been sentenced for their parts in the drugs supply chain .
the men , who are all from the grantham area , are aged between 19 and 38 .
the court heard that one of them - jermaine francis ( - moved up from the capital to head up the operation ; he was jailed for 8 years .
the other men were handed sentences ranging from 6 years in prison , to 16 months in a young offenders institution .
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: knight to see you
text: a week after it was attacked by vandals , one of lincoln 's knights for the knight 's trail is back in the city .
proud knight had a rather nasty crack to the bed of his head .
he was taken to cardiff to be fixed .
two people were arrested and charged following the incident which also saw another knight thrown into the river .
he 's now back on his plinth and will be back under the stonebow tomorrow .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: housing plans in nettleham scrapped
text: plans to build 200 new homes in nettleham near lincoln have been scrapped .
the national planning inspectorate rejected the plans because they were at odds with wider plans for the area listed in the neighourhood plan .
west lindsey district councillor giles mcneill is glad they 've been rejected :
i 'm delighted , i 'm absolutely thrilled , it 's very much an end for the moment .

whether they 'll come back with a more appropriate development of around a 50 number for the site allocation in the local plan i do n't know , but certainly i think the scale of development they propose will not now happen .
he added the neighbourhood plan is about empowering communities to make decisions about how they want their communities to develop .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : getting cloudier
text: most parts of the county should see a dry day with bright or sunny spells , although cloud may be thick enough to give the odd shower , mainly in the west .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: st giles community centre to become new youth centre
text: a lincoln youth club which was burned down almost a year ago wo n't be re-built .
fire ripped through st giles youth centre last september .
managers want to improve and add a play park to neighbouring st giles community centre which youngsters can use instead .
leader of the lincolnshire county council martin hill says its makes sense to use the present community centre which is next to where the old youth centre stood :
the variety of space can be used by young people for community group activities and our positive futures team who also provide activities for young people .
groups who used the old building can still access a local venue virtually on the same site and this wo n't impact on community groups who already use the centre .
money used to run the centre will be put back into providing services instead .
the council will also resurface the games area and provide new play equipment .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: update : 13-year-old cyclist injured in collision with car
text: yesterday we told you that a teenage boy was seriously injured after being involved in a collision with a car on his bicycle in new york .
lincolnshire police have now said the injured cyclist is a 13-year-old local boy .
he was taken to boston pilgrim hospital then transferred to the queens medical centre in nottingham , where he remain in a serious condition .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: sleaford alzheimer 's group going from strength to strength
text: now you may remember when the alzheimer 's society had to shut its sessions in sleaford due to funding cuts at the end of last year .
well a new group was set up and they 've raised £ 7,000 to keep it going .
the dementia support group says they 've been overwhelmed by the support and donations .
bex mezzo from the new group , says it 's going from strength to strength
we 've now got a good bank balance and we 're able to sort of do things and we 've got a lot of people who are passionate about the group .
we 've got a really good nucleus of volunteers that really help to keep the group going and support us .
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: double signing for lincoln city
text: lincoln city have completed the double signing of peterborough united 's michael bostwick ( left ) and harry anderson ( right ) .
central midfielder bostwick has played over 200 times for peterborough during their spells in the championship and league one , and was named their player of the year last season .
he has been linked to moves with the likes of sheffield united and blackburn rovers in the past 12 months .
as for anderson , the winger showed what he could do during two separate loans spells with city last season as he helped them gain promotion to the football league .
bostwick signed a two-year deal with anderson agreeing a three-year contract , and the pair have signed for undisclosed fees .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: three escape uninjured from flipped car on lincoln ermine
text: three people escaped uninjured after a crash which saw a car overturn on the ermine estate in lincoln .
as reported previously , a section of laughton way near redbourne avenue was closed after the crash involving two vehicles .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: canwick hill in lincoln closed this weekend
text: a major route into and out of lincoln will be closed this weekend .
canwick hill will be closed from 20:00 tonight until 05:00 on monday .
it 's to allow for work to be carried out on the international bomber command centre being built nearby .
diversions will be in operation .
author: Rod Whiting
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: dispersal order put in place over the weekend
text: the police have secured a dispersal order for this weekend to tackle anti-social behaviour in lincoln .
officers will be targeting begging , street drinking and people using drugs .
it means the police can ask people to move on and not return to the area for 48 hours .
it comes into force tomorrow morning and lasts for 48 hours .
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lifesaver scheme hits 10,000 target
text: lifesaver scheme hits 10,000 target

documents.title: save a life hits its target
text: after only three months bbc radio lincolnshire 's campaign to get 10,000 people trained to perform cpr has reached its target !
in fact , we surpassed our target with 10,414 people trained .
the campaign was launched in april after radio lincolnshire newsreader charlotte wright 's life was saved by a passer-by performing cpr .
charlotte collapsed while out running in lincoln in november 2016 , after suffering a cardiac arrest .
seven weeks later , she was back at work reading the news .
to have reached the 10,000 mark in such a short amount of time is amazing .
i still ca n't quite believe what happened to me but i 'm so happy that my experience has inspired people in lincolnshire to learn this life saving skill .
and it 's not stopping there , the campaign will now continue to the end of the year to see just how many people in lincolnshire can be trained .
drop us an email for more details .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: food for thought
text: lincoln 's first food bank summit is being held today with the aim of tackling the growing problem of food poverty .
different groups , including supermarkets , religious groups , politicians and food banks are attending the event .
organiser caroline kenyon says it 's a chance for different groups to work together .

it 's a real source of sorrow to me and to many that we have so many food banks in lincoln and there are lots of fantastic organisations that are working to help in this area but i wanted to bring everybody together .
issues discussed will include food waste , whether food banks have a good supply of varied and fresh food and how to support and educate the people who receive the food know how best to prepare it .
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : a bright and sunny ahead
text: most parts of the county should see a dry day with bright and sunny spells , although cloud may be thick enough in places for the odd shower .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to friday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be keeping you up-to-date with live news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the county until 18:00 .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch and let us know what you 're up to .
you can send an email , or a message on facebook or twitter .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln sign bostwick and anderson
text: lincoln sign bostwick and anderson

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: that 's all folks !
the rolling feed of news will return at 8:00 tomorrow morning , in the meantime i 'll leave you with five stories from the day :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: christmas light switch on thief jailed
text: a man who admitted being involved in a high value raid of a jewellery shop in gainsborough has been sent to prison for two years .
30 year old bruno nikolik from st john 's terrace in the town acted as a lookout while another man stole jewellery worth £ 35,000 .
the included a diamond necklace and five rings ( above ) .
it happened at marshall 's yard on the night the christmas lights were switched on last november .
his accomplice has n't been traced - and the items have n't been recovered .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: graduation day for lincoln students
text: if you 've been hit by a flying mortar board whilst in uphill lincoln today , you have students at bishop grosseteste university to blame .
it 's one of their graduation days today time to feel incredibly old :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: suburban road closed after car crash
text: lincolnshire police say a road in suburban lincoln has been closed due to a crash .
laughton way , at a junction with redbourne drive has been closed .
fire services , an ambulance and police are at the scene .
alan glenister , who sent us the above , says a car has flipped over after hitting a parked car .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire olympian in hockey finals
text: gold medal winning shona mccallin mbe is hoping to recreate her olympic success with a win at the hockey world league tonight .
the olympian is part of england 's women 's hockey team who 've made it to the semi finals of the world hockey league .
they take on the usa 's team in south africa this evening .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: international gp recruitment pilot `` a success ''
text: a pilot scheme to attract doctors from overseas to work in lincolnshire has been been praised as a solution to address the county 's shortage of gps .
dr radi sultan , partner at the ingham practice in lincoln which has been running the scheme , says `` it 's a very good programme that addresses this recruitment issue '' .
just a few months ago lincoln 's a & e had to declare a `` critical incident '' due to the shortage of doctors .
new recruit , dr mihaela koroknai , ( above ) joined the surgery after working as a gp in her native romania .
it was not a difficult thing to choose to do - it was a marvellous chance .
i worked in london for three years but it is better here in lincolnshire .
it is more friendly , calm and a better environment to live in .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: nightclub saddened by death of lincolnshire teen
text: a nightclub in barcelona have extended their `` sincerest sympathies '' to the family and friends of a lincolnshire teen who died after an event there .
19-year-old alex masterton had been at the clubbing event in the spanish city and collapsed outside .
he was found by security staff and treated by on-site medical staff .
he was then transferred to a nearby hospital where he had a cardiac arrest and died .
organisers elrow say they 're deeply saddened by `` this tragic event '' .
we extend our sincerest sympathy to the families and friends of the victim at this sad time and are supporting all authorities with their enquiries .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : an unsettled afternoon
text: here 's a look at the weather for the rest of the day with me , paul hudson :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: hospital staff shortages could impact patient safety , says mp
text: urgent action is needed at hospitals in grimsby , scunthorpe and goole to tackle critical staff shortages in two departments , according to the trust which runs the hospitals .
the trust board of northern lincolnshire and goole nhs foundation trust says it will look at options relating to the urology and ent departments next week .
clinicians say urgent action is needed because both of these services are facing critical workforce challenges , which are set to worsen in the coming weeks .
grimsby mp melanie onn says she 's worried about the impact it will have on the local community :

my main concern is not just that we do n't have enough people to do the jobs , but that it 's impacting on patient safety and now it means that people in great grimsby are going to have to travel further for emergency treatment when it comes to urology if this proposal is passed .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: `` jeremy corbyn passes me in the corridor and says , 'hi karen ' ''
text: i 've been speaking to lincoln 's new mp karen lee on the final day of work before parliament goes on its summer break .
she says it 's been a surreal start to the job , but that everybody has been really friendly :
author: William Wright
Drivetime Presenter - BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'sexual ' strangler jailed for teen 's death
text: 'sexual ' strangler jailed for teen 's death

documents.title: teenage cyclist seriously injured in car accident
text: a teenage boy has been seriously injured after being involved in a collision with a car .
it happened at just after 13:00 today on sandy bank road in new york near boston .
he 's been taken to pilgrim hospital .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: medical group rated `` inadequate '' by inspectors
text: sleaford medical group has been put under special measures after being rated as `` inadequate '' by inspectors .

an inspection of the group , which includes the riverside surgery in sleaford ( found that patients `` were at risk of harm '' because some systems and process in place `` were not effective to keep them safe '' .
a statement from the group says that `` the failures relate to certain areas where the cqc considers the practice to be inadequate or requiring improvement '' .
one of the gp 's says the problems mentioned are being addressed or have already been fixed :
some elements of the service we provide have not been to the expected standard .
these areas have either been resolved or are being addressed and we would like to apologise to our patients for any concern that may have been caused as a result .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: scampton airshow adds filmstar to lineup
text: roll out the red carpet or maybe the red runway because a film star - of sorts - is joining the lineup of the scampton show .
it 's sally b , europe 's only airworthy boeing b-17g flying fortress .
the warbird had a starring role in classic war film memphis belle .
the iconic bomber acts as a flying memorial to the tens of thousands of allied airmen who lost their lives in wwii .
the inaugural scampton airshow takes place on 9 and 10 september this year .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln 's mp wades into rubbish debate
text: the mp for lincoln , karen lee , has joined the debate about the building of a controversial waste transfer site in the city .
local residents on long leys road in the city campaigned against the plans by french waste service giant veolia .
lincolnshire county council turned down the application - the company has appealed against the decision .
long leys lincoln
longleyslincoln
karen , the long leys community thanks you for getting involved to help residents .
twitter.com/karenleemp/sta
karen , the long leys community thanks you for getting involved to help residents .
pleased to help
back to lincoln today for a busy week-end & for requested meeting next week with veolia
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: grandfather cycling to rome for charity
text: most of us say we 'd do anything for a family member who 's fallen ill .
well dave edwards from gainsborough is putting that into practice by going on a 1,250 mile bike ride to raise money in aid of his newly born grandson .
his grandson edward was diagnosed with cystic fibrosis when just a few weeks old , and dave wants to raise money for the cystic fibrosis trust .
so far he 's raised £ 1,330 for the charity .
he hopes he 'll arrive in rome in just 18 days .
being 50 is a landmark but supporting my little grandson will be the main inspiration on what i know will be a tough challenge .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire raf playing `` vital role '' in romania
text: raf personnel from lincolnshire are `` bolstering collective security '' in part because of an `` assertive russia '' according to a pilot on deployment in romania .
staff from raf coningsby have been deployed in romania since march to help police airspace in eastern europe .
wing commander lewis cunningham says there 's no specific threat but that the work is in part due to an `` assertive russia '' .

although there 's no specific threat to nato on this flank , obviously it 's common knowledge that russia are being very assertive in this part of the world and hence in part , our presence here to bolster our collective security .
author: Phillip Norton
BBC News

documents.title: breaking'sexual thrill ' strangle killer jailed for 12 years
text: a man who got a `` sexual thrill '' from strangling women has been jailed for 12 years for the manslaughter of a 16-year-old girl .
james morton , 24 , called 999 saying that he had accidentally killed hannah pearson , from marston in lincolnshire , after starting to strangle her .
police found her naked and lifeless body on the floor of his bedroom in newark in july 2016 .
he was cleared of murder but convicted of manslaughter yesterday at nottingham crown court .
in mitigation , shaun smith , said morton had been `` pursuing his sexual thrill without having regard for the consequences of it '' .
author: Caroline Lowbridge
BBC News Online

documents.title: tributes paid to `` lovely lad '' who died on holiday with school friends
text: friends have paid tribute to 19-year-old alex masterton who died whilst on a trip to barcelona with his friends .
he 'd been at a clubbing event in the spanish city at the weekend when he collapsed and died .
alex 's friends and schoolmates gathered in his home town of louth to remember him and pay respects .
he 'd been a pupil at king edward vi grammar school in louth .
his school say staff and pupils who knew and taught alex were `` shocked and deeply saddened to hear of his passing at such a young age '' .
they described him as a `` lovely lad with real personality '' .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: north kesteven `` safest place to live '' in england
text: perhaps people in north kesteven are far too busy taking part in its annual walking festival ( to be out committing crimes .
today new national crime statistics show there were fewer crimes committed in the district than in any other area in england and wales .
the statistics analysed how many crimes were committed per 1,000 residents .
north kesteven recorded 26.1 crimes per 1,000 people and it 's the fourth year in a row it 's recorded fewer crimes than other districts in the country .
but the numbers also show that both theft and violence against the person in the district rose since last year 's results .
the new figures also show that lincolnshire , with 50.3 crimes per 1,000 , moved from fifth safest county to fourth .
it 's pleasing to know that lincolnshire remains one of the safest counties in england and wales .
it 's particularly admirable given the fact that we are one of the lowest-funded areas for policing in the uk .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: bystanders 'mocked and goaded ' police officer making arrest
text: a police chief says he 's `` disappointed '' that bystanders goaded and mocked a police officer who was arresting someone drinking on a street in skegness .
ch insp collin haigh said members of the public filmed the incident and laughed and joked while a pc was wrestling with the offender.in skegness earlier in the week .
he says he 's disappointed that the public put street drinking at the top of the police 's agenda but act like they did in this incident .
laughing and joking whilst that incident is going on while an officer is wrestling with somebody and could be seriously hurt , i do n't think it 's acceptable .
it 's a serious incident , let the police do their work .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: family reacts to hospital fine over impaling
text: the family of a man who died after being impaled at pilgrim hospital in boston say they `` bear no malice towards the trust or to members of staff '' .
john biggadyke was being treated for cirrhosis of the liver when he died as a result of the incident .
keith biggadike described his brother as a `` very positive man '' who was looking forward to getting out of hospital .
he said the accident was `` avoidable '' but stopped short of condemning the hospital trust .
lincoln crown court fined united lincolnshire hospital trust £ 1m for the incident .
what happened was avoidable .
the training was inadequate .
however , we bear no malice towards the trust or to the members of staff . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: i 've got a brand new combine harvester
text: we 're surrounded by acres of arable land here in lincolnshire , and this time of year it 's a hive of activity .
i 've spent the morning at manor farm in acthorpe near louth .
it 's raining so the combine harvesters are n't out at the moment , so they let me have a look inside the space age cab of the machine :
here 's a driver 's eye view from the cab of a lincolnshire combine harvester .
look carefully : can you spot the @ twitterid satellite van ?
author: Rod Whiting
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : today 's forecast
text: it 's looking a bit drizzly out there .
here 's my full weather forecast for lincolnshire :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to thursday 's live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to our live news coverage for lincolnshire .
i 'm harry and i 'll be keeping you up-to-date with news , sport , weather and travel from across the county unti l18:00 .
if you have any comments , get in touch .
drop me an email , or get in touch on facebook or twitter .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: teenager dies on holiday in spain
text: teenager dies on holiday in spain

documents.title: massage death man guilty of killing girl
text: massage death man guilty of killing girl

documents.title: hospital fined for impaled patient death
text: hospital fined for impaled patient death

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: well that 's it from me today , we 'll be back tomorrow will all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county .
for now i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire to benefit from £ 50,000 of floods funding
text: lincolnshire will be better protected from flooding thanks to a new natural flood scheme announced by the floods minister therèse coffey .
the wild trout trust have been successful in obtaining £ 50,000 of funding to deliver a restoration scheme near the village of dunston .
the project aims to slow the flow and increase the storage capacity for water on the flood plain to reduce the risk of flooding in the village .
it will also provide a habitat for wildlife and a place for people to enjoy .
flood defence technology and engineering is better than ever and by using a mix of natural and concrete defences , we can provide the best flood protection for individual areas .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your weather this evening
text: heavy thundery showers this evening will ease during the first half of the night , with some clearer spells developing .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: plans to turn a pub into a shop
text: there 's concern a pub in north lincolnshire could be turned into a supermarket .
the co-op wants to convert the royal oak in barrow upon humber .
their first application was turned down by north lincolnshire council .
barrow resident ann boulton says they leafleted people to see what their opinion was and most people were against it .

in a statement , co-op said : `` we value the views of the community , and the re-submission of the planning application will allow residents and interested parties to register their views on our proposals . ''
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: gainsborough boss to cut players
text: the gainsborough trinity manager dave frecklington says he 'll be cutting his squad down in the coming days .
the blues lost 1-0 to league 1 side rotherham united in a pre season friendly last night .
the boss says he 'll be telling the players which ones will be leaving soon .

there 's no one guaranteed a shirt at this football club anymore , obviously we 've got a team in mind , a squad in mind but they 've all done enough to stake a claim but like i say we 've only got a budget to work to , it 's going to be a tough decision to let people go
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: louth student dies on holiday
text: the foreign office have confirmed they 're supporting a british family after the death of a young lincolnshire man in spain .
it 's understood the 19-year-old had just completed his a levels at king edward sixth grammar school in louth .
he 's been named locally as alex masterton .
it 's believed he was on holiday with friends when he collapsed .
author: Maggie Curtis
News Editor, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: scrap metal collectors fined
text: two scrap metal collectors operating in north kesteven have pleaded guilty for not carrying the relevant paperwork .

john winter , 24 , and 23-year-old harry drury , both from newark , pleaded guilty for failing to furnish waste transfer notes on request from the district council and for failing to produce a waste carriers license when requested a police officer .
the pair were pulled over in billinghay in january by police , and their case was referred to the council after they failed to show the relevant paperwork .
mr winter was fined £ 379 and mr drury , £ 300 .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: a very special occasion at lincoln cathedral
text: it 's graduation season and students from lincoln 's bishop grosseteste university have been receiving their degrees at the cathedral .
do send in your graduation photos and stories , we love to see them .
you can get in touch by email , facebook or twitter .
we 're here at @ twitterid ready for the first # bgugrad2017 ceremony of the day
the atmosphere is building !
only ten minutes to go until we kick off # bgugrad2017
we 're underway !
the procession is in and the first # bgugrad2017 ceremony is officially opened .
we have our first graduates !
see our instagram story for more # bgugrad2017
just a few certificates to hand out # bgugrad2017
not a bad spot to graduate !
looking good @ twitterid # bgugrad2017
first ceremony done !
congratulations everyone # bgugrad2017
photo time !
# bgugrad2017
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: bransby horses get new intensive care unit
text: a lincolnshire-based horse charity has just finished building a new intensive care unit .
the unit at bransby horses is funded entirely by legacies and donations from an appeal .
it will allow them to treat some of the sickest and most vulnerable animals .
the icu has hoists in the stables to support weak horses and they are coated in a spongy rubber to make sure the horses do n't injure themselves .
as you can imagine breeze blocks , bricks are very abrasive .
if a horse was to stumble into because its either too weak to stand on its own or its recovering from an anesthetic they would very easily damage the skin and cause unfortunate injury to themselves .
author: Melvyn Prior
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your afternoon headlines
text: our top stories so far today from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: hospital trust responds to £ 1m fine
text: united lincolnshire hospitals nhs trust ( ulht ) have responded to the outcome of the court case which saw them fined £ 1m for the death of a patient .
john biggadike , from spalding , was impaled by a metal post which resulted in his death in april 2012 .
the post made up part of the hoist and was left exposed :
we are disappointed by the outcome of this court case and the settlement to the treasury but fully accept the verdict .

we felt that it was important to defend this case , not least because of the history of two other similar incidents involving this piece of equipment which we had not been aware of at the time of mr biggadyke 's tragic death .
we would like to offer our sincere condolences to the family of mr biggadyke .
author: Maggie Curtis
News Editor, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your weather this afternoon
text: the risk of some heavy thundery showers - take a look at when you should have your brolly with you today :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: signature move brings in big money
text: an autograph book has sold for £ 1,000 at auction in lincoln .
pauline mcnally from woodhall spa collected signatures when she worked at the lyric theatre in london .
she worked there for nearly 20 years from 1982 as stage door receptionist .
whenever she welcomed somebody news , she would ask them to sign her autograph book .
her collection of signatures includes billy connelly , robby coltrane , bill nighy , mick jagger , eric clapton and members of the royal family including hrh queen elizabeth and prince phillip .
when pauline finished at the theatre she was presented with the album which just went at auction .
i did n't think it would go for that amount of money , i only thought it would be £ 30-£ 50 not £ 1,000 !
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: ulht fined £ 1m following death of patient
text: united lincolnshire hospitals nhs trust ( ulht ) has been fined £ 1m following the death of a patient at boston 's pilgrim hospital .
john biggadike , from spalding , was impaled by a metal post which resulted in his death in april 2012 .
the post made up part of the hoist and was left exposed .
during the trial the jury heard the staff were not adequately trained to use the hoist and had instead devised their own system for operating is contrary to the manufacturer 's instructions .
ulht was also ordered to pay £ 160,000 prosecution costs and £ 3,800 compensation to mr biggadike 's brother to cover the cost of the funeral .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: skegness slur lotto ad woman offered tour
text: skegness slur lotto ad woman offered tour

documents.title: this afternoon 's weather
text: some brighter spells should develop through the afternoon , turning hot and humid .
however cloud will bubble up , with further thunderstorms likely , and a risk of torrential downpours .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: permanent location for sleaford needle exchange service being sought
text: sleaford 's needle exchange will remain at boots until the end of august .
the service was forced to shut after staff had to deal with increasingly hostile and dangerous situations .
but it will stay in the shop while the local council and addaction , the drug support service , work with local pharmacies to find a permanent alternative .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: our top stories so far today from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: hundreds of pounds scammed out of elderly man
text: a man from near lincoln says his life very nearly spiralled out of control after being conned out of hundreds of pounds .
jeff , who does n't want his full name revealed , was bombarded daily with dozens of scam letters inviting him to take part in winning prize money .
the 88-year-old had also been placing up to 12 orders a month for unwanted items like vitamins and cosmetics , racking costs of £ 2,500 .
he lost hundreds of pounds over three years before being helped by lincolnshire 's trading standards and the police .

jeff thought there was just a slim chance that he could win lots of money , so he started to send off small amounts of money initially and this increased and slowly but surely over the following months he was giving up to a couple of hundred pounds a month .
scams are a problem across the uk .
the office of fair trading estimate british consumers lose around £ 3.5 billion pounds to scams every year .
however , it remains largely unreported , lincolnshire county council have advice on how to spot and report a scam .
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : lincolnshire police will be given best taser training
text: lincolnshire police insists its staff will be given the best possible training to use tasers .
it comes after the force reaffirmed their commitment to train half their officers to carry the weapon .
lincolnshire 's assistant chief constable shaun west says they go beyond the national standard .
@ lincspolice are looking to train more officers to use tasers .
@ twitterid explains why he wants to see more officers equipped .
author: George Smith
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire 's typhoons in romania for air policing mission
text: typhoons from raf coningsby are providing around the clock security in the skies above parts of eastern europe .
3 fighter squadron are working alongside the romanian air force until the end of august as part of operation biloxi .
four typhoons and 143 staff from raf coningsby are over there at the moment .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: police warn children against hoax 999 calls this summer
text: managers at east midlands ambulance service are urging children not to make hoax calls to the 999 emergency line .
their appeal comes as hundreds of schools prepare to close for the summer break during which staff say they usually see a rise in the number of calls .
mike parker from emas says they usually see a rise in false calls during the holidays
parents sit with your children , get them to understand the rationale why you 'd call 999 .
if it 's an emergency situation , if someone is in cardiac arrest but not just to ring us because they may see it as a bit of fun .
only ring 999 if you need an ambulance .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: trees outside lincoln station could be felled following accident which trapped man
text: the trees in front of lincoln railway station could be chopped down after one fell and trapped a man in his car last month .
the man escaped unhurt but officers working on the transport hub have applied to take down the five remaining trees and replace them with ones in purpose built pits .
the city of lincoln council says that the current ones have damaged roots and it 's not safe to keep working to upgrade the front of the station until they 're gone .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: councillors 'extremely concerned ' about plans to close lincoln walk-in centre
text: lincolnshire 's health watchdog says it 's `` extremely concerned '' about plans to close lincoln 's nhs walk-in centre .
councillors on the health scrutiny committee say residents are `` deeply worried '' there wo n't be any suitable alternatives in place .
the committee is considering the proposal from lincolnshire west clinical commissioning group at a meeting today amid concerns about the impact on the wider area .
the ccg says the plans would cut down on the duplication of services .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'anywhere but skegness ' woman will be given a tour of the resort
text: a woman who snubbed skegness in a tv advert for the national lottery has been invited by the mayor to see what the town has to offer .
gina parkin , from leeds , was featured in the ad in which people said where they would take their families if they won millions .
she replied `` anywhere but skegness '' , prompting anger among hoteliers and businesses in the resort .
she says she regrets making the comment and is looking forward to her weekend .
i did an apology .
i felt so awful because i 'd seen some press and some upset locals and i felt for them , i felt for everybody in skegness .
i just felt terrible .
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: final day at school after combined 50 years
text: it 's the last day at school for many pupils across lincolnshire today and it 'll be a very emotional day for one county couple .
andrew and joanna hyde are head and deputy head of the edward richardson primary school at tetford near horncastle .
today they are saying goodbye to the school after almost 50 years of combined service .
we do know all of the children very well , we know details about them , we know their names , we know the names of the younger siblings who have n't come to school yet .
i pride myself on knowing which football teams the parents support so we can have conversations about things that really matter .
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : a cloudy , possibly rainy day
text: a breezy but cloudy morning , with isolated heavy showers possible , perhaps thundery .
these clearing with brighter spells developing , and turning hot and humid .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to wednesday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18:00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: scunthorpe sign belgian midfielder ojo
text: scunthorpe sign belgian midfielder ojo

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it for tuesday - we 'll be back tomorrow from 08.00 with more live updates from across the county .
breaking news , weather and travel will appear here overnight .
just before we go let 's look back at five things we 've found out during the day :
bye for now !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : coming up on look north
text: here 's @ twitterid with the look north headlines .
see the full programme at 6.30 on bbc one ( sky 957 )
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: coroner 's warning over farm electrocution
text: a lincolnshire coroner has issued a warning to farm workers after hearing evidence about the death of an 18-year-old on his family farm .
mr fisher said the evidence was very touching , and that grown men had been in tears describing what had happened .
he advised farm workers to be more aware of the dangers posed by power lines and added : `` the level of vigilance needs to be increased .
`` you need to pass on the need for your employees to take care . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: ambulance appeal over 999 hoaxes
text: managers at east midlands ambulance service are urging children not to make hoax calls to the 999 emergency line .
their appeal comes as hundreds of schools prepare to close for the summer break .

parents sit with your children , get them to understand the reasons for calling 999 , if it 's an emergency situation , if someone 's in cardiac arrest - not just to ring us because they may see it as a bit of fun . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : dry but breezy
text: a warm and dry with evening sunshine , and a notable easterly breeze , especially along the coast .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: teen 's death on farm a 'sad case '
text: the death of an 18-year-old from lincolnshire who was electrocuted while working on his parents farm , has been declared a 'sad case ' according to a coroner .
jackson maplethorpe below had been cleaning dirt out of a tipper trailer at digby fen in november last year when the top of it touched an overhead power line .
stuart fisher , the coroner who heard evidence about the death during a two-day inquest which finished today said the case had been very difficult .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: grimsby mp lands fisheries role
text: the mp for grimsby has a new role .
melanie onn has been elected chair of the all party parliamentary group for fisheries .
ms onn , who has campaigned for fairer treatment for the town 's fishing industry , is second from left with other members of the committee .
author: Sarah Sanderson
Political Reporter East Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire

documents.title: rebranded school named after battle hero
text: the new name for the cherry willingham community school has been revealed .
from september it will be the priory pembroke academy .
the priory federation of academies says it commemorates the first earl of pembroke who secured victory for the english army over the french forces in the battle of lincoln 800 years ago .
the federation already runs three secondary schools in lincoln and one in grantham .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: farm electrocution was an accident inquest rules
text: an inquest has recorded a verdict of accidental death on a lincolnshire farm worker .
jackson maplethorpe from billinghay , between lincoln and boston , was electrocuted on his family 's farm .
the 18-year-old tipped a trailer which hit overhead power lines .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: missing girls found
text: we were telling you earlier about two girls who had gone missing from gainsborough - here 's the latest from lincolnshire police :
we are pleased to update that the two missing teenage girls have been found safe and well .
^nm
great news ! ! ! !

documents.title: police recruitment campaign attracts more than 300 applications
text: lincolnshire police says it 's had 363 applications to join the force after its latest recruitment campaign .
the drive , which started in may was extended after what senior officers described as a disappointing response .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: football : fans kick off training ground crowdfunder
text: imps fans are fundraising to help buy the club a new training ground .
lincoln city have been looking at a number of possible sites .
now a group have set up a crowdfunding page called cowleys ' perfect pitch .
the group says it hopes to raise £ 100,000 towards the project .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: dispersal order in force in skegness
text: anti-social behaviour and street-drinking are back in the sights of police in skegness today .
another dispersal order is in place until midnight tonight .
it gives officers the powers to move people on and confiscate alcohol .
it 's the second time in a week an order 's been imposed - and comes after an officer was assaulted while arresting someone for being drunk and disorderly in the resort .
dispersal notice in place # skegness until midnight tonight .
one arrest already made by @ twitterid
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: can you help find missing girls ?
text: here 's the latest appeal from lincolnshire police - the two girls have been missing since last night from the gainsborough area and are believed to be together :

documents.title: weather : a sunny afternoon to come
text: here 's your forecast for this afternoon - looks good but there is a weather warning for some thundery downpours :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: town to get first new play area in six years
text: long-running negotiations over a play area on a grantham housing estate have finally ended - with plans now in place .
south kesteven district council ran a public consultation on the park in springfield road two years ago , but it 's taken until now to get agreement from everybody involved .
the project is being paid for with money contributed for community facilities by builders persimmon and taylor wimpey as a requirement of their planning permissions to build 400 homes on the site .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: park and ride service clocks up 10,000 passengers
text: lincoln 's new park and ride service has passed a major milestone - with more than 10,000 people using it since its launch in february .
the route which runs from waitrose , close to the lincoln bypass , into the city centre , costs £ 2.50 , with accompanied children free .
the service is run by the lincoln business improvement group ( big ) .
chief executive matt corrigan says a survey 's been carried out among passengers asking what improvements they want .
it shows people want clearer and more permanent signage from the bypass and more posters on board the buses to show the route and the destination .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: jack 's marathon swim hopes sink a second time
text: here 's the latest from my colleague nick hope who 's with the british marathon swimming squad in budapest for the world championships .
jack burnell , who 's from north hykeham near lincoln and was born in scunthorpe , has just missed out on a place again .
he was disqualified at the olym - leading to a bout of anger followed by a new determination to win .
it 's more marathon swimming agony for gb 's jack burnell as he finishes 4th in world 10km event .
follows his olympic disqualification in rio .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: hundreds call for crackdown on 'boy racers ' in cleethorpes
text: hundreds of people are calling for something to be done to stop people racing their cars along cleethorpes prom .
cleethorpes ward councillor matthew brown has put a petition together with 400 signatures which he 'll present to full council on thursday .
he says the problem has been going on for 30 years .
humberside police say they were aware of the problem and wanted people to contact them with concerns so they could get a full of the issue .
author: James Piekos
Reporter, BBC Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: a quarter of gp appointments 'wasted ' on minor complaints
text: gps in lincolnshire say one in four of their appointments are now taken up by minor ailments that can be handled elsewhere .
new figures released by the county 's nhs show people are going to the doctors with problems like colds and hayfever , which they can treat themselves .
a lincolnshire gp says on average he wastes one day a week dealing with patients who could be treated elsewhere .
dr radi sultan - who works in ingham - says too many people come to his practice with minor illnesses like coughs and colds .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: men arrested over 'legal high ' possession
text: two people have been arrested for possession of so called 'legal highs ' in lincoln .
the men one in his 20s and the other in his 30s were spotted in st swithin 's square ( below ) at the weekend .
it comes after local businesses and residents complained about anti-social behaviour in the area .
the police are reminding people psychoactive substances became illegal at the end of last year .
the men have been released while investigations continue .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: life expectancy rates in region 'below national average '
text: east yorkshire is the only part of our area where both men and women can expect to live longer than the national average , according to public health england figures released today .
life expectancy rates in hull , north lincolnshire and north east lincolnshire are all falling below the average for males and females .
university college london expert sir michael marmot said he was by the national situation , saying it was `` entirely possible '' austerity was affecting how long people live .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: sell-by date cafe offers three courses for three quid
text: all the food on the menu at a new cafe in lincoln is past its sell-by date - but that 's not putting off the customers .
everything you see in the video below has been rejected by supermarkets and bought up by the city 's mint lane cafe .
crucially the food is not past its use-by date - meaning the cafe can offer a three-course meal for £ 3 !
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: force wants half its officers taser-trained
text: senior police officers say they want half of lincolnshire 's front line police to be trained in the use of tasers .
more officers are about to be trained - but force chiefs say they do n't expect to see a spike in the weapons ' use .
the force says between april 2016 and march 2017 a taser was drawn from a holster 209 times and reholstered without use 85 times .
figures show a taser was fully discharged in that year just 25 times - with the threat of its use being adequate on all other occasions .
when our officers run towards danger i personally want to see them kept safe and leave uninjured , so they can then deal with the next incident .
it is my aim to ensure one in every two officers on patrol are trained and equipped with a taser .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: plans submitted for 999 centre
text: a new centre to house police , fire and ambulance staff in lincoln will improve services in the city , according to leaders of the three emergency services .
plans have been submitted for the development on south park avenue on the site of the current fire and ambulance hqs .
lincolnshire 's police and crime commissioner marc jones says it 's an ideal base for all three services .
work will begin on the project in october if planning permission is granted .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : another sunny day on the way
text: dry with sunny periods , which will be occasionally hazy , and initially light winds .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to tuesday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18.00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learnt today
text: that 's it from me today - we 'll be back tomorrow with more live updates from across the county .
just before we go let 's have a look back at five things we did n't know when we started out this morning :
bye for now !
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: your weather forecast
text: enjoying the afternoon sun ?
much of the same on the way tomorrow .
here 's my full forecast .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : look north headlines
text: here 's peter levy with the headlines from look north tonight :
here are the latest headlines from @ twitterid
look hull tonight !
hull hull hull
what a load of crap .
seagulls are wild not angry .
waste of news .
hull city are being shafted .
report on that
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: two people sustain potentially serious injuries following crash on a46
text: the a46 lincoln bypass has been closed between between doddington road roundabout and skellingthorpe road roundabout following a crash earlier today .
the incident involved several vehicles and happened at around 15.00 gmt this afternoon .
two people have sustained potentially serious injuries and emergency services are currently on the scene .
traffic is heavy in the area and motorists are asked to seek alternative routes if possible .
it is expected the road will be closed for at least another hour .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: lorry stuck under bridge in grantham
text: the a607 harlaxton road in grantham is closed .
a lorry is stuck under the railway bridge .
traffic has built up in the surrounding area
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: market trader jailed for selling fake clothes
text: a market trader who was caught selling fake clothing on the lincolnshire coast has been jailed for 18 months .
a raid at eastgate market in ingoldmells found more than 1,000 counterfeit items .
29-year-old roshan singh from lincoln road in skegness had denied 12 charges including the unauthorised use of a trademark .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: service at sea to remember lost trawlermen
text: seven crewmen who died on board a grimsby fishing trawler in world war one , while it was working to clear german mines , have been remembered in a service at sea .
the trawler , alberta , was discovered by the shipwrecks of the river humber research team , who are locating all 375 vessels that were lost .
after a plaque for the crew members was placed on the wreck , a service of remembrance was held above it .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: plans revealed for new ambulance , fire and police station in lincoln
text: more than 400 emergency services staff will be housed at the new tri- service station , located on the site of the existing fire and ambulance station on south park avenue , lincoln .
the building will be home to ambulance crews covering the lincoln area , lincoln south 's firefighters and police officers and staff , currently located at west parade .
as part of the development , the existing fire training tower and workshops will be retained and refurbished to create additional operational space .
if approved by lincolnshire county council 's planning committee , enabling works on site will start in october 2017 , with full construction starting early 2018 .
the plans are being welcomed by the managers of all three organisations involved .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: here our the top stories from our lincoln newsroom this afternoon :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: it could have been you !
text: a £ 1 million lottery prize has gone to good causes - because its lincolnshire winner was n't found .
the ticket was bought in north kesteven in january .
the deadline to claim the euromillions money passed at midnight .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: grimsby teenager charged with assault
text: a 16-year-old from grimsby 's been charged in connection with an assault at the trivoli tavern last week .
a 35-year-old man sustained serious injuries .
the teenager 's been charged with wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm on 13 july 2017 .
humberside police are appealing for help in identifying these two men who are wanted in connection with the same incident :
if you know who these men are thej you can call humberside police on 101 quoting log 523 of 13 july 2017 .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: inquest into death of lincolnshire farm worker begins
text: an inquest has heard that an 18-year-old farm worker was trying to clear dirt and debris from a trailer when he was fatally electrocuted .
jackson maplethorpe from billinghay was working on his family 's farm last november , when he raised the trailer into overhead power lines .
the inquest at lincoln cathedral centre continues .
author: Jake Zuckerman
BBC Look North

documents.title: m180 closed in both directions
text: m180 is closed both ways .
there 's queueing traffic due to a police incident between j3 m181 ( scunthorpe ) and j4 a15 / a18 ( scawby ) .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: sport : new lincolnshire world champion & world record holder
text: lincolnshire 's hollie arnold broke her own f46 world record in the javelin at the world para-athletics championships in london to win gold .
arnold who won paralympic gold in rio last year has now won three successive world titles .
heckington 's kieran tscherniawsky came 5th in the f33 shot whilst grantham 's sam ruddock was 7th in the f35 shot .
author: Su Whitaker
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

the imps say they are looking to arrange another friendly fixture to replace this cancellation .

documents.title: grimsby sign striker cardwell
text: grimsby sign striker cardwell

documents.title: boston man paralysed in a freak accident marries fiancee and stands to say vows
text: a former fire fighter from boston , who broke his neck last year on his stag do , finally tied the knot this weekend .
james thorpe was paralysed from the chest-down in a freak accident last summer - and his wedding had to be postponed .
he managed to stand for the ceremony on friday , as well as having a first dance with his new wife michaela .
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: have your say on louth 's livestock market
text: you have until early september to have your say on the future of lincolnshire 's last remaining cattle market .
a consultation 's getting underway into louth livestock market .
three options are being considered by east lindsey district council including ending a centuries old tradition .

the lincolnshire rebellion started in louth and we 've got fire in our bellies and we will fight every inch of the way to maintain our charter and to maintain what we think is right for this town and the district ''
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : staying dry and sunny this afternoon
text: dry with largely unbroken sunshine this afternoon .
highs of 25c ( 79f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: £ 15,000 grants up for grabs to improve gainsborough 's shop fronts
text: grants of up to £ 15,000 are being offered to improve shop fronts in gainsborough .
businesses are being encouraged to apply to west lindsey district council for the money .
the scheme is available to businesses in the following town centre locations :
this grant is a great opportunity for tenanted or empty shops located in the area to apply for a grant to do renewal and repair work .
i would encourage as many people as possible who are eligible to apply for the funding to do so . ''
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: do you know who this man is ?
text: police want to speak to this man in connection with an indecent act in lincoln .
officers have been made aware of a report that a man was seen carrying out an indecent act outside the waterside shopping centre last week after a video was circulated on social media .
an investigation 's been launched and police would like to talk to the man in relation to this incident .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather watchers : it 's a blue sky kind of day today !
text: thanks to our bbc weather watchers for sending in these lovely this morning .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: final day of glenfield heart surgery consultation
text: the consultation over the future of a heart unit , used by sick children from lincolnshire , will end today .
nhs england wants to shut the centre at glenfield hospital in leicester because it 's not meeting standards .
campaigners have been fighting to try and keep it open .
the consultation was extended because of the election .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: is this your lawnmower ?
text: police stopped a man who was riding this lawnmower along the a1031 towards marshchapel in the early hours of yesterday morning .
the 23-year-old was arrested on sus of theft and going equipped for burglary .
he was later released under investigation .
police belive the mower us stolen and would like to trace the owner so if you 've had a similar model go missing , recently call lincolnshire police on 101 quoting incident number 53 of july 16 .
is this your lawnmower ?
it was recovered in the early hours of sunday near north cotes .
^nm
think i may have seen this on friday evening on the b1200
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: recruitment crisis partly to blame for £ 10m supply teacher bill
text: problems finding staff are being partly blamed for millions of pounds being spent on supply teachers in lincolnshire .
local authority-run schools - not including academies - have spent £ 10m on supply teachers and support staff over the past three years .
the nut says many are being put off by the workload and salaries on offer .

chris rolfe , a principal lecturer in education at nottingham trent university and who used to be a headteacher here in lincolnshire , says `` there 's one academy trust in the county who are advertising 31 vacancies '' .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: escaped boston man recaptured
text: a handcuffed man who escaped police custody in boston has been re-captured .
aurimas butkys fled last thursday but was found by officers in kent yesterday .
the 25-year-old lithuanian was re-arrested at about 16.00 gmt after a number of police appeals for information .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : your weather this morning
text: it 's good news folks- today 's set to be a dry and very warm day with light breezes and long spells of sunshine .
highs of 26c ( 79f ) .

documents.title: welcome to today 's live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to a new week .
my name 's lizzie and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates until 18:00 .
got something going on near you ?
or something you want to tell us about ?
you can get in touch via facebook , twitter or email .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire
